thread.title: Union football falls to 0-6 with loss to WPI
thread.title_full: Union football falls to 0-6 with loss to WPI - Times Union

author: Staff reports
title: Union football falls to 0-6 with loss to WPI
text:
The Union College football team dropped its sixth-straight game, 29-21, to visiting Worcester Polytechnic Institute on Saturday at Frank Bailey Field in Schenectady.
The Dutchmen fell to 0-6 overall and 0-3 in the Liberty League .
Zach Grasis rushed for 168 yards and a score to lead WPI, which climbed to 4-2 overall and 1-2 in league action.
Union held a 14-9 lead late in the second quarter before Jack Reilly picked off a pass from WPI quarterback Dan Eckler and raced 73 yards for a touchdown to give the Dutchmen a commanding 21-9 lead with only three minutes, 25 seconds remaining before halftime.
But WPI quickly came down the field on its next possession and cut the Union advantage to 21-16 on an Eckler to Brandon Eccher 39-yard touchdown strike two minutes in front of the halftime break that started a 20-0 run to close the game.
Grasis put WPI ahead to stay at 7:03 of the third quarter, scoring on a 1-yard run, and Eckler closed out the scoring for the Engineers with a 15-yard touchdown run with on 53 seconds left.
Union is off next weekend but returns to action on Oct. 24 at Rochester.
